Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can include different types of living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, and bushes for land; fish and clams for water.
The student can show a variety of animals and plants in each habitat, like lizards, squirrels, ants, and flowering plants in a land habitat, and fish and aquatic plants in a water habitat.
The student can use observations of real or media examples to help accurately represent the habitats.
The student can illustrate and label the diversity of life correctly in each habitat.
The student can highlight the differences and similarities between the plant and animal life in the two habitats.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly compare the different types of living things in each habitat.
